Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, part of the interior is covered with a black deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-orange slip and faint traces of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink. Text containing a possible liturgy.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393250) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393250)
